docs.snippet: In the 51 years since intergration, the university has made inclusion and racial healing a theme, but problems persist....
docs.lead_paragraph: In the 51 years since intergration, the university has made inclusion and racial healing a theme, but problems persist.
docs.abstract: University of Mississippi officials are investigating episode in which audience members heckled performers during theater department's production of play The Laramie Project, about an anti-gay hate crime; incident is seen as sign that school still struggles with the legacy of its integration in 1962, which resulted in two deaths and dozens of injuries.

headline.main: University of Mississippi Investigating Anti-Gay Heckling at Theater Performance
headline.print_headline: University of Mississippi Investigating Anti-Gay Heckling at Theater Performance

byline.contributor: Kim Severson reported from Oxford, and Alan Blinder from Atlanta.
byline.original: By KIM SEVERSON and ALAN BLINDER

docs.snippet: Tropical Storm Karen, though weakening on Friday, was still powerful enough to prompt evacuations and warnings of storm surges and heavy rainfall along the Gulf Coast....
docs.lead_paragraph: Tropical Storm Karen, though weakening on Friday, was still powerful enough to prompt evacuations and warnings of storm surges and heavy rainfall along the Gulf Coast.
docs.abstract: Tropical Storm Karen chugs its way toward the Gulf Coast, prompting usual preparations and drawing federal response workers out of furloughs; storm is currently not expected to reach hurricane strength, but officials with the National Hurricane Center insist, as they do every year, that residents in its path should not dwell too much on storm categories or rely too strictly on the black line that delineates a storm’s predicted trajectory.

headline.main: Gulf Coast Storm Pulls Federal Workers Off Furlough
headline.print_headline: Gulf Coast Storm Pulls Federal Workers Off Furlough

docs.snippet: Flush with Abu Dhabi’s wealth, the government-owned Etihad Airlines has emerged as a go-to financier in Europe for struggling rivals, helping raise its global profile....
docs.lead_paragraph: Flush with Abu Dhabi’s wealth, the government-owned Etihad Airlines has emerged as a go-to financier in Europe for struggling rivals, helping raise its global profile.
docs.abstract: Government-owned Etihad Airlines, flush with Abu Dhabi’s wealth, is emerging as go-to financier in Europe for struggling rivals, helping raise its global profile; Etihad once faced stiff resistance from established flag carriers like Lufthansa, British Airways and Air France-KLM, but attitude has changed as Europe's economic crisis erased billions in airline profits and wiped out thousands of jobs, causing them to reach out for financial lifeline.

headline.main: Upstart Abu Dhabi Airline Becomes Ally to European Carriers
headline.print_headline: Upstart Abu Dhabi Airline Becomes Ally to European Carriers
